description: Returns a description of virtual tapes that correspond to the specified Amazon Resource Names (ARNs). If TapeARN is not specified, returns a description of the virtual tapes associated with the specified gateway. This operation is only supported for the tape gateway type. The operation supports pagination. By default, the operation returns a maximum of up to 100 tapes. You can optionally specify the Limit field in the body to limit the number of tapes in the response. If the number of tapes returned in the response is truncated, the response includes a Marker field. You can use this Marker value in your subsequent request to retrieve the next set of tapes.

parameters.name: GatewayARN
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the  ListGateways operation to return a list of gateways for your account and Amazon Web Services Region.

parameters.name: TapeARNs
parameters.description: Specifies one or more unique Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) that represent the virtual tapes you want to describe. If this parameter is not specified, Tape gateway returns a description of all virtual tapes associated with the specified gateway. (string) ---

parameters.name: Marker
parameters.description: A marker value, obtained in a previous call to DescribeTapes. This marker indicates which page of results to retrieve. If not specified, the first page of results is retrieved.

parameters.name: Limit
parameters.description: Specifies that the number of virtual tapes described be limited to the specified number.

nested_items.name: Tapes
nested_items.description: An array of virtual tape descriptions.

nested_items.name: TapeARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape.

nested_items.name: TapeBarcode
nested_items.description: The barcode that identifies a specific virtual tape.

nested_items.name: TapeCreatedDate
nested_items.description: The date the virtual tape was created.

nested_items.name: TapeSizeInBytes
nested_items.description: The size, in bytes, of the virtual tape capacity.

nested_items.name: TapeStatus
nested_items.description: The current state of the virtual tape.

nested_items.name: VTLDevice
nested_items.description: The virtual tape library (VTL) device that the virtual tape is associated with.

nested_items.name: Progress
nested_items.description: For archiving virtual tapes, indicates how much data remains to be uploaded before archiving is complete.

nested_items.name: TapeUsedInBytes
nested_items.description: The size, in bytes, of data stored on the virtual tape.

nested_items.name: KMSKey
nested_items.description: Optional. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side encryption. Storage Gateway does not support asymmetric CMKs. This value must be set if KMSEncrypted is true, or if EncryptionType is SseKms or DsseKms.

nested_items.name: PoolId
nested_items.description: The ID of the pool that contains tapes that will be archived. The tapes in this pool are archived in the S3 storage class that is associated with the pool. When you use your backup application to eject the tape, the tape is archived directly into the storage class (S3 Glacier or S3 Glacier Deep Archive) that corresponds to the pool.

nested_items.name: Worm
nested_items.description: If the tape is archived as write-once-read-many (WORM), this value is true.

nested_items.name: RetentionStartDate
nested_items.description: The date that the tape is first archived with tape retention lock enabled.

nested_items.name: PoolEntryDate
nested_items.description: The date that the tape enters a custom tape pool.

nested_items.name: Marker
nested_items.description: An opaque string that can be used as part of a subsequent DescribeTapes call to retrieve the next page of results.
